# wav2vec2 audio frame classification

Code used for the paper ["Detection of Prosodic Boundaries in Speech Using Wav2Vec 2.0" (TSD 2022)](https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-031-16270-1_31) 

(This repository is a work in progress)

![w2v2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48019906/193046350-37b1616c-e3e8-497e-b5ed-19c0c0ccb027.png)

## Prosodic boundary detection

Example training data (one line per 30s wav file, 50 labels / second):
```

### Code:

- data preparation: TBA
- training: `wav2vec2_audioFrameClassification.py`
- evaluation: TBA

## Citations

Prosodic boundary detection: [TSD 2022 paper](https://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-031-16270-1_31)

```
@inproceedings{Kunesova2022,
author={Kune{\v{s}}ov{\'a}, Marie and {\v{R}}ez{\'a}{\v{c}}kov{\'a}, Mark{\'e}ta},
title={Detection of Prosodic Boundaries in Speech Using Wav2Vec 2.0},
booktitle={Proc. Text, Speech, and Dialogue (TSD) 2022},
year={2022},
pages={377--388},
}
